title: Ops Resilience: First Signs
description: Unusual power fluctuations across Singapore's grid. Sensors are reporting anomalies that don't match any known fault pattern. DIS suspects a sophisticated cyber intrusion into critical infrastructure.

software-engineer.title: Instrument the Anomaly Detectors
software-engineer.instruction: You need to deploy monitoring probes across the power grid's SCADA systems to catch the intrusion pattern before it escalates. Put the deployment steps in the right order.

items.label: Map all SCADA endpoints and their network connections
Deploy lightweight monitoring agents to each SCADA node
Record 2 hours of normal behaviour to establish a baseline
Configure anomaly thresholds based on the baseline data
Wire up the alert pipeline so anomalies immediately notify the SOC

data-scientist.title: Classify the Anomaly
data-scientist.instruction: The sensor data shows a pattern unlike anything in the playbooks. You have 30 minutes to classify the threat before leadership decides on a response. What analytical approach do you take?

options.label: Run the data through the trained intrusion detection model. Fast answer in 5 minutes but the model was trained on known attack patterns and this looks novel.
Manual forensic analysis comparing the pattern against historical incidents and threat intelligence feeds. Takes the full 30 minutes but produces a high confidence classification.
Run three different detection models and take the majority vote. Slower than a single model but much more robust against novel attacks.
Share the anomaly signature with partner CERT teams and ask if they've seen it before. Could get an answer in 10 minutes but you're showing your hand to external parties.

cloud-engineer.title: Estimate the Blast Radius
cloud-engineer.instruction: The anomaly has been active for an unknown period. Based on network traffic anomaly scores over the last 4 days (higher = more suspicious activity), estimate how many SCADA nodes (out of 200 total) may already be compromised.
